name: Givelight Foundation
mission: Givelight Foundations primary exempt purpose is to provide shelter, clothing and food to children who have been orphaned by a natural disaster or other global crisis; to provide educational, spiritual and social services to the children residing in these orphanages.
theoryOfChange: Givelight Foundation has a published 'Our Model' page that outlines their strategic approach to establishing and running orphanages globally. This document details a step-by-step process, including researching credible organizations, securing donated land, selecting qualified staff, and providing long-term care and education. The model emphasizes a need-based approach focused on the children's long-term well-being, education, and development to help them reach their full potential.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://givelight.org/zakat (Source: https://givelight.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 40/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves into mission delivery, while keeping a clear operating reserve floor.
components.name: Financial Health

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: GiveLight Foundation shows strong alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://givelight.org/zakat (Source: https://givelight.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: GiveLight Foundation holds a Charity Navigator score of 94.66666666666667/100 and holds 135.0 months of working capital.
The organization is zakat-eligible and follows specific policies for asnaf categories.
Total revenue was $2,186,834 with a program expense ratio of 88.7% and fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised.
The charity provides various donation options and giving methods for supporters.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 68/100 GMG score due to its high financial efficiency and strong alignment with donor values, though its impact score is moderated by the cost per beneficiary.

Increase direct impact measurement to boost overall impact scoring

dimension_explanations.alignment: The charity shows high alignment for donors seeking global education and orphan care, specifically offering zakat-eligible programs [2][4]. Its track record of building specific homes like Noordeen in Indonesia and facilities in Sri Lanka and Bangladesh highlights a focused commitment to its mission [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: GiveLight demonstrates a direct provision model with a program expense ratio of 88.7% and a Charity Navigator score of 94.66666666666667/100 [1][3]. While the cost per beneficiary is calculated at 1377.806, the organization maintains an extraordinary 135.0 months of working capital to ensure long-term stability for its orphanages [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: GiveLight Foundation provides a global network of loving homes and educational support for orphaned children facing extreme circumstances.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 88.7%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach beneficiaries
Exceptional fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity with 135.0 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: GiveLight Foundation is a crisis relief organization that builds sustainable homes and families for orphans in countries including Indonesia, Sri Lanka, and Bangladesh [1][3]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations through various asnaf categories [2].

alignment.improvement: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="5">overall score of 94.94.66666666666667/100 from Charity Navigator</cite> and transparent financial reporting.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could expand its board beyond the current <cite id="8">4 members</cite> to enhance independent oversight.

rich_narrative.headline: GiveLight Foundation provides a global network of loving homes and educational support for orphaned children facing extreme circumstances.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support global orphan care with highly efficient financial models and zakat-eligible giving.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations with confidence
Prioritize organizations with zero fundraising overhead
Care deeply about providing long-term homes and education for orphans
giving_considerations: The organization holds significant reserves, meaning immediate donations may not be spent instantly
Governance structure is relatively small for its asset size
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking organizations that rapidly deploy all incoming funds year-over-year, or those looking for large institutional governance structures.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization tracks verified outcomes and has a documented theory of change, though it lacks rigorous independent RCT evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: GiveLight plans to build beautiful homes on a global scale to meet the immediate needs of orphaned children.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that interventions effectively improve the lives of orphans and provide sustainable, long-term benefits.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While the cause area has high need, the organization's excessive working capital suggests it currently has significant unspent capacity.

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 88.7%</cite> and an outstanding <cite id="4">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, ensuring maximum impact for every dollar donated.
GiveLight Foundation has earned an <cite id="5">overall score of 94.94.66666666666667/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting robust leadership and impact.
The charity is <cite id="6">zakat-eligible</cite>, providing a verified avenue for Muslim donors to support orphans globally.

strengths_deep_dive: GiveLight Foundation distinguishes itself through unparalleled financial efficiency. By reporting a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 88.7%</cite> and a <cite id="4">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, the organization demonstrates a remarkable ability to channel resources directly to its core mission of orphan care. This efficiency is recognized externally, as evidenced by its <cite id="5">overall score of 94.94.66666666666667/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: GiveLight Foundation, established in <cite id="1">2004</cite>, is a crisis relief organization dedicated to building loving homes and providing educational support for orphaned children globally. The organization operates in multiple countries, including Indonesia, Bangladesh, Cambodia, and Sri Lanka. In its most recent filings, the charity reported <cite id="2">$2,186,834 in total revenue</cite>. GiveLight demonstrates extraordinary financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 88.7%</cite> and an exceptional <cite id="4">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization is highly rated by independent evaluators, holding an <cite id="5">overall score of 94.94.66666666666667/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>. Furthermore, GiveLight Foundation is <cite id="6">zakat-eligible</cite>, allowing Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations while supporting vulnerable orphans across various asnaf categories.
